title: E field and potential map - field at pts P and Q

content.question: The figure shows equipotential lines in a region of space with an electric field, along with two points labeled <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math> and <math alttext="Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Q</mi></math>. Which of the following best represents both the direction and the relative magnitude of the electric field at points <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math> and <math alttext="Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Q</mi></math>?

choices.label: The figure shows electric field vectors pointing to the left extending from points P and Q. The vectors have the same length.

The figure shows electric field vectors of the same length extending from points P and Q. The electric field vector from Point P is directed toward the left, and the electric field vector from Point Q is directed toward the right.

The figure shows electric field vectors directed to the left extending from points P and Q. The electric field vector extending from Point Q is longer than the electric field vector extending from Point P.

The figure shows electric field vectors extending from points P and Q. The electric field vector extending from Point P is short and directed to the left. The electric field vector extending from Point Q is long and directed to the right.

content.answer: The figure shows electric field vectors directed to the left extending from points P and Q. The electric field vector extending from Point Q is longer than the electric field vector extending from Point P.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
